intro: Oncostema villosa, commonly known as the hairy oncostema, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine, hairy texture, giving it a distinctive appearance. Oncostema villosa typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in wetlands or along stream banks.
